meanings.definition: The layer of material inside a shoe that provides cushioning and support for the foot.
meanings.sent1: The innersole of my shoe keeps my feet comfortable all day.
meanings.sent2: Make sure the innersole is properly cushioned for extra support.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally put my innersole in my friend's shoe, and now it's too comfy for him!
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like an innersole, always there to support me when I needed it.
meanings.sent5: The innersole felt like walking on clouds, making every step a delight.

meanings.definition: A removable insert placed inside a shoe for added comfort and support.
meanings.sent1: Don't forget to replace the innersole regularly for better foot health.
meanings.sent2: She bought gel innersoles to make her shoes more comfortable.
meanings.sent3: The innersole jumped out of the shoe and started dancing around the room!
meanings.sent4: His words acted as an innersole, providing comfort during difficult times.
meanings.sent5: With the new innersole, her shoes felt like a cozy hug for her feet.
